name: The Westin Melbourne

reviews.text: I stayed here for four days on business and had an extremely relaxed stay. On arrival at 7 am my room was immediately available allowing me to freshen up for the day ahead. The room was well appointed and extremely spacious. I only had one breakfast which while excellent at the current sterling exchange rate seemed expensive.
reviews.title: Classy comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During my stay the staff were always helpful and responsive and he calming atmosphere of the hotel made it a great retreat from the hussle of the city outside. The central location of the hotel meant all my meetings were easily accesible by foot and there are great dining options on your doorstep.
reviews.title: Amazing Melbourne Experience

reviews.text: Watch out for high laundry charges, but all in all a great stay in this vibrant and cosmopoitain city.
reviews.title: Always great friendly service

reviews.text: Hi all, just returned from a 2 night stay and the beautifully presented Westin Melbourne on Collins Street! Just like all the great reviews said, I also enjoyed the perfect Melbourne experience thanks to the location of this hotel and amazing Concierge service we received!
reviews.title: If you have a bad back, avoid.

reviews.text: I usually am a bit hesitant to let someone else decide where I eat out however this Concierge choose the most amazing Italian restaurant 1 block from the Westin in a very quiet alley way. We were more than impressed by the restaurant and the enthusiasm from all the staff who organised this last minute decision for us.
reviews.title: A room in the exact heart of Melbourne
The best in Melbourne
reviews.text: Simple elegance and attentive staff made this an enjoyable trip for us. Perfect location, and comfortable quiet rooms. We recommend the delux Room overlooking season street!
We used to stay at the Langham but we think it is over rated and not worthy of its #1 status. It is tired.
reviews.title: Great hotel right in the heart of the city

reviews.text: Very nice hotel! Modern and stylish rooms with great views and the best beds I have ever slept on!
reviews.title: Seamless, stylish and spoilt!

reviews.text: We used the Westin Melbourne as our base for our girls weekend away (two nights, twin bed suite) and we had very little to complain about.
reviews.title: Would get an excellent rating but for one thing...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was spotless. The room perfect. The location was right in the centre of our retail heaven. Cafe's everywehre...in fact rather than just stay in one place for a meal, we did progressive meals. Entree / Cocktails @ the Long Room, a to die for main/wine @ Bistrot and dessert @ Ganache Chocolate!! All within a short stroll. So many food options within a short distance.
reviews.title: Great for a Holiday Break Too...

reviews.text: Wow! Room upgrade, champagne chocolates and strawberries. Could not be more helpful and everything went wonderfully well with the surprise for my wife. Well done Westin. 6 stars.
reviews.title: 20th wedding anniversary

reviews.text: Earned two free nights via the Starwood "Be Happy" promotions (it pays to be a SPG member if you enjoy travel, membership is free). We were allocated a room on the SPG floor (3rd floor) overlooking a busy street but we could hardly hear any street noise. Bathroom was quite huge, with two sinks, a separate shower and bathtub. We loved their Sweet Sleeper king sized bed which was for some strange reason much better than the Sheraton beds in Asia. The indoor lap pool and small spa were nice, but the gym was miniscule and claustrophobic. We attended the solemn 11:00 am service at St. Patrick's Cathedral and hurriedly walked back to the hotel to have Easter lunch at their Allegro Restaurant. The entrees and mains although not buffet style but shared platters were delicious and beautifully prepared. Dessert was buffet with all you can eat chocolate eggs. We also had dinner at the Lobby Lounge and saw a few comedians who were in town for the Melbourne Comedy festival. A different but enjoyable way to spend the Easter break.
reviews.title: Easter in the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We having been staying here for the past 7 years and it just seems to get better every time. the rooms are spacious, as are the bathrooms. The bed is heavenly as they promote. In walking distance to lane way cafes, Bourke St Mall, premier restaurants and an amazing hairdresser located directly across the road. Definitely would recommend this hotel to would be travelers.
reviews.title: Prime 5 star hotel in CBD Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were delighted with yet another stay at The Westin Melbourne. The position is perfect for us being right in the heart of the city and the rooms are spacious and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Friendly and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BUT the greatest asset this hotel has is the friendly and helpful staff. We received a very warm welcome from Brad on the driveway and from Katie at the front desk. Both staff members remembered us and went out of their way to make us feel special. Management should be congratulated for encouraging such a friendly atmosphere in a 5 star hotel. It was very refreshing.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in the heart of Melbourne.

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Westin in Melbourne for the weekend.It's a good hotel, not as grand as some of the other Westin's we have stayed in, but pretty nice all the same.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The location is tops, right in the heart of everything.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel
Good location and love westin workout 24 hours open
reviews.text: The staff were very good and the breakfast was of a good standard. The rooms are comfortable with good bathrooms and we had a small balcony, which was nice.

Things that werent so good: Wifi, come on guys, I've stayed in 3 star hotels where you have wifi in your room and you dont need to hire a router. You need to be early for breakfast, there was a line to get in even before 9.00.In fact, most of the common areas were crowded. The pool whilst great looking and good temperature, had way too high levels of chemicals, it was a goggles only zone, particularly for kids.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Overall, good hotel and great location.
reviews.title: Great location, but expensive

description: Modern, chic and elegantly understated, The Westin Melbourne’s dramatic staircase and light filled lobby overlooking the vibrant City Square sets the tone for one of Australia’s leading hotels. Boasting 262 luxurious guest rooms, the award winning property is surrounded by theatres, galleries, designer boutiques and the city’s finest attractions.
